data.title: Brum
data.meta_description: Brum is a children’s television show created by Frank Beattie and Anne Wood in Ragdoll Productions in 1991, Pre-Ragdoll shows such as The Book Tower, Ragdolly Anna, Puzzle Party and Roland Rat were introduce in the 70s and 80s, then Anne Wood is known for other children shows founded the company...
data.text:
Brum is a children’s television show created by Frank Beattie and Anne Wood in Ragdoll Productions in 1991, Pre-Ragdoll shows such as The Book Tower, Ragdolly Anna, Puzzle Party and Roland Rat were introduce in the 70s and 80s, then Anne Wood is known for other children shows founded the company and began working on other programs on Pob's Programme, Teletubbies, Rosie and Jim, Boohbah, Tots TV, Playbox, Blips, Tronji, The Magic Mirror, BOOM!, Storytime, Open a Door, Badjelly the Witch, What Makes Me Happy, Dipdap, The Adventures of Abney & Teal, Twirlywoos, What Shall We Do With The Angry Monster?, B.O.T. and the Beasties and In the Night Garden... The little car was first seen on TV on Children’s BBC and CBeebies until the series came to an end in 2002.
